name: Valsartan

indications_original: Valsartan tablets are an angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB) indicated for: • Hypertension , to lower blood pressure in adults and children 1 year and older. Lowering blood pressure reduces the risk of fatal and nonfatal cardiovascular events, primarily strokes and myocardial infarctions ( Error! Hyperlink reference not valid. ) • Heart failure (NYHA class II to IV), to reduce hospitalization for heart failure in adults ( Error! Hyperlink reference not valid. ) • Post-myocardial infarction , for the reduction of cardiovascular mortality in clinically stable patients with left ventricular failure or left ventricular dysfunction following myocardial infarction in adults ( Error! Hyperlink reference not valid. )
contraindications_original: Indication Starting Dose Dose Range* Hypertension Adults ( Error! Hyperlink reference not valid. ) 80 to 160 mg once daily 80 to 320 mg once daily 1 to 16 years ( Error! Hyperlink reference not valid. ) 1 mg/kg once daily Up to 40 mg daily 1 to 4 mg/kg once daily Up to 160 mg daily Heart Failure ( Error! Hyperlink reference not valid. ) 40 mg twice daily 40 to 160 mg twice daily Post-Myocardial Infarction ( Error! Hyperlink reference not valid. ) 20 mg twice daily 20 to 160 mg twice daily *As tolerated by patient
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Valsartan is available as tablets containing valsartan 160 mg. All strengths are packaged in bottles as described below. 
                     Valsartan Tablets USP, 160 mg are yellowish brown colored, oval shaped, biconvex, film coated tablets, debossed with ‘184’ on one side and ‘H’ on the other side. They are supplied as             
                     Bottle of 30 Tablets                                                                   NDC 82804-154-30
                  Bottle of 90 Tablets                                                                   NDC 82804-154-90             
                     
                     Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].               Protect from moisture.               Dispense in tight container (USP).
